text: was an old province of Japan in the area that is today Fukushima Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Iwaki" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 408. It was sometimes called .Murdoch, James. (1903). A History of Japan, Vol. 3. p. 794. The history of the province started in 1868 and ended in 1869. ==History== During the Edo period and early Meiji period, the Date clan were daimyo in the area.Papinot, Edmund. (2003). Nobiliare du Japon -- Date, pp. 5 [PDF 9 of 80;] Papinot, Jacques Edmond Joseph. (1906). title: Iwaki Province (1868)
